channel.title: R.i.p. rsps
channel.description:
Spring 2004 - February 1, 2011. Return of wilderness. Return of free trade.
We all saw a huge influx of players when Jagex Screwed up by removing the wildy and free trade. Now they are fixing their mistake... Need I say more? R.I.P. RSPS
Discuss...

item.title: R.i.p. rsps
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

But when RS is easier its also less exciting.

Read full topic

item.title: R.i.p. rsps
item.dc:creator: @Slave_Scyth Slave Scyth
item.description:
@Slave_Scyth wrote:

[quote=“casey., post:8, topic:378946”]No, things are different than when RSPS were first introduced.

You can die with 20m and have it back in a day. Players aren’t leaving real RS for a site like this.
RS is so much easier than it was back in 06.[/quote]SO much agreement. I started playing back in '06, and shit was hard (maybe, not hard, but you had to actually work for things) – but fun – back then. You can’t even have fun without tons of gold anymore; the economy is screwed up the bumhole 5x over.

I personally came to RSPS simply because I wanted to make my own stuff; do it my own way. Not because of a lack of wildy or anything.

EDIT: Actually, now checking, I guess I started back in early '05. I forgot. I always use my rubber chicken as reference for when I started RuneScape for when I can’t remember. xD

Read full topic

item.title: R.i.p. rsps
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“blakeman8192, post:77, topic:378946”]I love how my post, which completely smashed this whole idea, is getting completely ignored. ;)[/quote]No it’s just that he’s saying RSPS will (almost) completely die in a short period of time, where as at the moment those stats show a short decline.

Though it doesn’t matter to me anyway, I stick by what I said earlier, that the activity of this site will rise.

Read full topic

item.title: R.i.p. rsps
item.dc:creator: @xxxxxx_13 xxxxxx 13
item.description:
@xxxxxx_13 wrote:

Whats irking me is that many of you are thinking along these lines:

Runescape before Freetrade was removed == Runescape after is restoration.
Which IS NOT true.

I understand more players playing RS Could mean more players for RSPS. But we won’t know if thats a true reflection.

In addition. This is purely a business plan for Jagex to push forth other Runescape Themed Projects and unexplore niches. They will do whatever they can to keep the majority happy.

Read full topic

item.title: R.i.p. rsps
item.dc:creator: @k0_twin k0 twin
item.description:
@k0_twin wrote:

Javafire:

the decline of this forum also has nothing to do with runescape, it’s mainly the staff, users, and blandness of the forum. No good developments are really coming from moparscape.

I don’t really see how it’s the staffs fault. They can’t control who joins and force people to contribute, they just maintain the community and keep things orderly. But I would agree that the decline is probably due to a combination of different factors.

Read full topic

item.title: R.i.p. rsps
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

[quote=“Squirt Ltd, post:65, topic:378946”][quote author=HcoJustin link=topic=474803.msg3473244#msg3473244 date=1295467138]

But even if they don’t, there are alot of overpowered weapons and armor… Pking will never be the same as it was in 2004-5-6

Just gonna pick on your for a minute. With this old wilderness coming back, no one is going to risk their chaotic, because of smite. It takes far too much time to get it back, so no one is going to risk it. Why risk claws if you’re going to get smited and lose them? It is a risk, but I sure as hell wont use them unless I’m rushing. Give it a week or two and everyone will start going back to whip/dds pking.

Not everything overpowered takes time to get back, take for example korasi sword and shit like that

Korasi is the only real exception, but its not even that great. Its just a welfare weapon that can easily be avoided if you’re decent.
[/quote]

How? And with turmoil + dds you can hit… over 9000[/quote]

That was in no way funny. Why would you use Korasi and DDS? Korasi’s spec would do much more damage, making it a one trick pony. It really is a welfare weapon. Hell, anything cheaper than a whip is welfare.

Read full topic

item.title: R.i.p. rsps
item.dc:creator: @xxlukexx xxlukexx
item.description:
@xxlukexx wrote:

people still stay and play and people will come. i don’t think it will die. as others have said, runescape isn’t the same as it was back in the day where it was all rune pking, g mauling etc.

there are new prayers, weapons etc which people don’t not like which is why people will continue to play and stay. i think players will go back to runescape (like me) but i will never leave this site and stop playing a p server along with it, because it feels the same as 06.

Read full topic

item.title: R.i.p. rsps
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

Uhm. When I first started playing on them, the wilderness and free trade was still all in place - and they seemed to be much more popular then than they are now.

Read full topic

item.title: R.i.p. rsps
item.dc:creator: @T3arful T3arful
item.description:
@T3arful wrote:

Why does everyone keep saying that the return of free trade and the wilderness will be the end of RSPS? Nothing is really going to happen. This site was more popular when the wilderness and free trade was around then it is now http://www.google.com/trends?q=moparscape

If anything there will be more people coming to private servers. With more interest in Runescape itself, there will be more people out there interested in emulation.

Everyone isn’t just going to leave, I’m pretty sure most of you still play Runescape now, be it botting or legitimately.
The return of the wilderness and free trade really isn’t that much of a big deal. It’s just over hyped.

Read full topic
